what is version of your jdbc driver?  upgrade your jdbc driver and try it again
duplicate #1754

> what is version of your jdbc driver? upgrade your jdbc driver and try it again

I have updated my jdbc drvier to mysql-connector-java-8.0.15 on the host of sharding_proxyï¼Œ mysql server is on the other serverã€‚  but it still hava the error of Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Unknown system variable 'query_cache_size'ã€‚

warning: mysql-connector-java-8.0.15-1.el7.noarch.rpm: Header V3 DSA/SHA1 Signature, key ID 5072e1f5: NOKEY
	package mysql-connector-java-8.0.15-1.el7.noarch is already installed

Ok,  I am glad to do so. I will try my best to figure out how to test  Logger. I am so excited  for my first code pull request have been merged.hahaha , I will take part in open source more positive in the future.

Hi @msnetc, I'm sorry, could you please describe as detailed as you can?
Before your respond. Let me guess what the problem is.
You JDBC(cliend)'s version is too low to match MySQL server 5.7. 

BTW, why and how you update JDBC on sharding-proxy host?

@bruceyan1220 , yes.
Has been fixed via https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/issues/1674.

fixed at #1817
fixed at #2038
I am working on it.
I added some code review comments on your pr
`log.info()` is not a static method

@songxu Hi, recently i am fixing this problem, and this issue occurrs to me. ShardingSphere needs a copy of metadata info to help parsing your SQLs, and checks the metadata consistancy of all the sharding tables. But there is a switch named `check.table.metadata.enabled` to decide to check it or not. If you don't want to cost too much time when startup, you can config this property. More details, please refer to our document. Thanks.
@msnetc Can you close issue if your question is resolved?
@lklkxcxc Can you close issue if your question is resolved?
I am not get your point. Can you provide a demo?

> I am not get your point. Can you provide a demo?

like hibernate automatic generation sql [insert into some_table values ( )], 
 '( )' contains blank will throw exception:
io.shardingsphere.core.parsing.parser.exception.SQLParsingException: SQL syntax error, expected token is 'RIGHT_PAREN', actual token is 'END', literals is ''

but the 1.4.2 version can support it .
`insert into id_generate values ( )`

Java code 
```java
        BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(OrderTest.class
                .getResourceAsStream("/sharding-config-order-test.yaml"), "utf-8"));
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        CharBuffer charBuffer = CharBuffer.allocate(32);
        for (int count = reader.read(charBuffer); count > 0; count = reader.read(charBuffer)) {
            sb.append(charBuffer.flip());
        }

        DataSource dataSource = YamlShardingDataSourceFactory.createDataSource(sb.toString().getBytes("utf-8"));
        Connection connection = dataSource.getConnection();
        Statement st = connection.createStatement();
        ResultSet rs = st.executeQuery("select ts_order.* FROM ts_order where order_id='abcd'");
```
sharding-config-order-test.yaml config 
```yaml
dataSources:
  ds_0: !!com.alibaba.druid.pool.DruidDataSource
    driverClassName: com.mysql.jdbc.Driver
    url: jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/test_d_1
    username: demo4
    password: demo135
    filters: stat
    initialSize: 2
    maxActive: 80
    maxWait: 5000
    testOnBorrow: true
    testOnReturn: true
    testWhileIdle: true
  ds_1: !!com.alibaba.druid.pool.DruidDataSource
    driverClassName: com.mysql.jdbc.Driver
    url: jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/test_d_2
    username: demo4
    password: demo135
    filters: stat
    initialSize: 2
    maxActive: 80
    maxWait: 5000
    testOnBorrow: true
    testOnReturn: true
    testWhileIdle: true

shardingRule:
  tables:
    ts_order:
      actualDataNodes: ds_${0..1}.ts_order_0${1..2}
      databaseStrategy:
        inline:
          shardingColumn: order_id
          algorithmExpression: ds_${order_id.hashCode() % 2}
      tableStrategy:
        inline:
          shardingColumn: order_id
          algorithmExpression: ts_order_0${order_id.hashCode() % 2 + 1}
```
